ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken?
What is your overall assessment of this course?
Do you expect to use this class for credit toward your major, or toward a pre-professional program?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize ECON 110 05 for a fellow student? Would you recommend ECON 110 05 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Greek L2 was taught by George this semester who has, fortunately, taught Modern Greek formany years. I found George's teaching style to be very different from Maria's (Greek L1), but one that was definitely for the better. George elevated the intensity of this class to a more conversational and grammar-heavy course. With biweekly quizzes (1 on vocabulary and 1 on grammar), I have to say that I learned a LOT this semester. Vocabulary quizzes often covered 100-200 words, but this studying was made up by simple homework assignments on nights that weren't dedicated to studying for the quizzes. Overall, I would highly recommend this course for anyone looking to learn more about Greek culture and Greek language. George was fantastic!
